Industrial units expect to close the financial yearon a POSITIVE NOTE

Registering a growth in tax collection in a region is usually an indication of the growth registered by industries in that area.

And, it looks like 2015-2016 was not a bad year for the industries Coimbatore.

Though industries, be it in textiles or engineering, say they are hit by economic slowdown and drop in orders, there is nearly 15 per cent growth in excise collection here so far this financial year compared to the same period last year.

Coimbatore is said to have nearly 4,000 Central Excise assessees and most of them are small-scale units.

Even if the units registered minimum growth, there is an increase in total excise revenue, say an official of the department.

With the financial year coming to an end, V. Lakshminarayanaswamy, president of Southern India Engineering Manufacturers’ Association, says there are several new industries that are coming up in Coimbatore.

Many are setting up factories here or at least the head office here and the units in the nearby towns. There is also a growth in the domestic market for many sectors.

Though the anticipated demand has not come, industries say that they are seeing domestic market growing.

These could be some of the reasons for higher tax revenue.

Further, some sectors might have grown better than the rest and this will also result in higher revenue, he said.

Reporting by

M. Soundariya Preetha
title: Revenue collection up
